summary: Successful entrepreneur with a revenue first focus. Extensive B2B/B2G sales and product development experience in hardware, software, and services. Bootstrapped a hardware development and manufacturing company with profitable cash flows. Now addressing the skilled labor shortage. Experienced in developing corporate and industry best practices, "training the trainers" to execute.

profile_positions.description:
Providing the technology and curriculum so "Anyone Can." At Adozi, we are driven by a resolute commitment to revolutionize the landscape of workforce development and education. Drawing from our firsthand experience in training the trades, we are determined to produce a superior hands on Learning Management System with comprehensive, adaptable, and engaging learning experiences.

We help organizations bridge the gap between theoretical learning and practical applications.
profile_positions.title: Founder & President

profile_positions.description:
Orchestrated successful due diligence efforts spanning 6 months, encompassing exhaustive site inspections and independent product verifications, leading to the acquisition of TowerIQ by Potter Electric Signal Company, a Gryphon Investors owned firm, on December 16, 2019.

Guided post-acquisition integration strategies, facilitating the transition to the broader organizational framework of Potter Electric Signal Company, during the early days of the pandemic.

Steered regulatory processes, securing Federal Communications Commission (FCC) approvals for new product offerings, reinforcing TowerIQ's compliance and expanding its market presence.

Drove marketing initiatives for novel products despite the challenges posed by the pandemic, leveraging strategic innovation and adaptability to maximize brand exposure and capitalize on emerging opportunities.

Collaborated as a key member of the executive leadership team, contributing to high-level decision-making and shaping the strategic direction of the combined entity, including follow on acquisitions.

Championed the advancement of TowerIQ's mission and impact within a larger corporate context, ensuring alignment with overarching goals and vision.

Resigned from roles at Potter Electric Signal Company and TowerIQ on April 2nd, 2021, following a period of impactful leadership and accomplishments. Departed with pride in the accomplished team and the enduring contributions made to TowerIQ's growth and success.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
Led the inception, growth, and successful sale of TowerIQ, a groundbreaking venture focused on addressing unfulfilled regulatory requirements within the American construction space. The company's mission, encapsulated by the tagline "Signal Where It Matters," revolutionized the integration of fire alarm and two-way radio communications in high-rise construction.

Innovative Startup: Recognized a distinct void in the American construction code, prompting the establishment of TowerIQ. Conceived and introduced new products, expertise, and standard practices at the intersection of high-rise construction, fire alarm systems, and two-way radio communications.

Strategic Bootstrapping: Initiated TowerIQ from the ground up, beginning with zero employees and limited resources, even utilizing a "stolen conference room table" as a workspace. Orchestrated the company's remarkable growth, expanding it to over 50 employees across four locations spanning two continents.

Strategic Partnerships: Forged strategic alliances by integrating TowerIQ's solutions into the distribution networks of major fire alarm manufacturers. Spearheaded industry-wide training initiatives, enabling rapid adoption and implementation of TowerIQ products by empowering partners to offer a new product category to their clients.

Industry Leadership: Led the formulation of industry-specific product and installation standards. Spearheaded comprehensive training programs, effectively "training the trainers" for TowerIQ products and broader industry standards. Instrumental in raising the industry's collective expertise and performance benchmarks.

Remarkable Sales Growth: Instrumental in propelling TowerIQ's meteoric rise, achieving a pinnacle of $20 million in sales. Combined innovative product development, strategic partnerships, and unparalleled industry leadership to realize outstanding revenue growth.
profile_positions.title: CEO and Founder

profile_positions.description:
Small Business Enterprise specializing in wireless telecommunication construction and network management services across the New York City metropolitan area.

Led diverse sales, deployment, and construction activities for wireless solutions.

Orchestrated a $12 million First Responder Communications System design-build project for World Trade Center Tower 1. Successfully established a joint venture with MER Group to secure financing and contract execution.

Oversaw the Metropolitan Transportation Authority account, managing sequential multi-million dollar contract renewals. Directly handled day-to-day communications for a fleet of 6000 vehicles, serving an average daily ridership of 2 million people. Responsibilities spanned coordinating PCB level electronic repairs to transmission site management.

Played a pivotal role in the company's strategic shift from taxi-cab communication management to government accounts. Led workforce evaluation, streamlining efforts, and the implementation of a company-wide ERP system.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

volunteer_experiences.role: STP Member, UL 2524 - In-Building 2-Way Emergency Radio Communications Enhancement Systems
